aclName.description: The name of the Access Control List to associate with the cluster.

autoMinorVersionUpgrade.description: When set to `true`, the cluster will automatically receive minor engine version upgrades after launch. Defaults to `true`.

dataTiering.description: Enables data tiering. This option is not supported by all instance types. For more information, see [Data tiering](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/memorydb/latest/devguide/data-tiering.html).

enginePatchVersion.description: Patch version number of the Redis engine used by the cluster.

engineVersion.description: Version number of the Redis engine to be used for the cluster. Downgrades are not supported.

finalSnapshotName.description: Name of the final cluster snapshot to be created when this resource is deleted. If omitted, no final snapshot will be made.

kmsKeyArn.description: ARN of the KMS key used to encrypt the cluster at rest.

maintenanceWindow.description: Specifies the weekly time range during which maintenance on the cluster is performed. Specify as a range in the format `ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi` (24H Clock UTC). The minimum maintenance window is a 60 minute period. Example: `sun:23:00-mon:01:30`.

name.description: Name of the cluster. If omitted, the provider will assign a random, unique name. Conflicts with `name_prefix`.

namePrefix.description: Creates a unique name beginning with the specified prefix. Conflicts with `name`.

nodeType.description:
The compute and memory capacity of the nodes in the cluster. See AWS documentation on [supported node types](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/memorydb/latest/devguide/nodes.supportedtypes.html) as well as [vertical scaling](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/memorydb/latest/devguide/cluster-vertical-scaling.html).

The following arguments are optional:

numReplicasPerShard.description: The number of replicas to apply to each shard, up to a maximum of 5. Defaults to `1` (i.e. 2 nodes per shard).

numShards.description: The number of shards in the cluster. Defaults to `1`.

parameterGroupName.description: The name of the parameter group associated with the cluster.

port.description: The port number on which each of the nodes accepts connections. Defaults to `6379`.

securityGroupIds.description: Set of VPC Security Group ID-s to associate with this cluster.

shards.description: Set of shards in this cluster.

snapshotArns.description: List of ARN-s that uniquely identify RDB snapshot files stored in S3. The snapshot files will be used to populate the new cluster. Object names in the ARN-s cannot contain any commas.

snapshotName.description: The name of a snapshot from which to restore data into the new cluster.

snapshotRetentionLimit.description: The number of days for which MemoryDB retains automatic snapshots before deleting them. When set to `0`, automatic backups are disabled. Defaults to `0`.

snapshotWindow.description: The daily time range (in UTC) during which MemoryDB begins taking a daily snapshot of your shard. Example: `05:00-09:00`.

snsTopicArn.description: ARN of the SNS topic to which cluster notifications are sent.

subnetGroupName.description: The name of the subnet group to be used for the cluster. Defaults to a subnet group consisting of default VPC subnets.

tags.description: A map of tags to assign to the resource. If configured with a provider `default_tags` configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.

tagsAll.description: A map of tags assigned to the resource, including those inherited from the provider `default_tags` configuration block.

tlsEnabled.description: A flag to enable in-transit encryption on the cluster. When set to `false`, the `acl_name` must be `open-access`. Defaults to `true`.
